reviews.comments: Verdaderamente hermoso el lugar, la pirámide y la hospitallidad de Juana hacen que la estadia sea muy placentera! Un lugar para descansar y estar en contacto con la naturaleza.  muy recomendable, para no olvidar!

Tuvimos una excelente estadía en la pirámide! Es espaciosa, con una vista inmejorable y bien equipada. Si bien está relativamente alejada del centro de Bariloche (20 min), está cerca del Circuito Chico y otras atracciones. Además el lugar es tranquilo e ideal para relajarse. La comunicación con Juana fue excente y se agradece su atención y hospitalidad! Muy recomendable!
Hermoso lugar, mucha paz y tranquilidad ,muriel muy atenta y servicial , muy recomendable

Muriel estuvo comunicada en todo momento, muy atenta, nos espero tarde a la noche.
La cabaña está lejos del centro, pero es exactamente lo que buscábamos, tiene unas vistas muy bonitas y no pasamos frío a pesar que afuera nevaba. 
Lo único que no nos gustó es que el baño no tiene bacha, lo que lo hace bastante incómodo. De todas formas eso termina siendo un detalle. Volveríamos sin dudarlo!

La vista era tan linda de adentro como de afuera de la pirámide. Sol, lluvia, estrellas y vegetación se veían maravillosas. Luminosa y cálida con el sol de la tarde; abriendo la puerta y ventanas, se refrescaba bien. En un grabador vintage pueden escucharse las radios de Bariloche. 
El jardín y el parque con los frutales crean un entorno muy especial.
Los perros muy cariñosos y la yegua, siempre atenta en su corral.
 Los paseos a pie por los alrededores, repletos de paisajes muy lindos. Es una zona muy agradable, agreste e ideal para descansar y desconectarse del cotidiano.
 La distancia de la ruta es de 2,5 km; importante saberlo por si no se tiene auto.

Es la segunda vez que nos hospedamos en la pirámide de Muriel y lo haremos cada vez que podamos.
El lugar, el confort y la atención de Muriel fueron tan buenos como el año pasado.
Una vez que estás instalado, no te dan ganas ni de salir de la cabaña!

Gracias Muriel y Familia por todo, la pasamos de 10 ! La casa es muy linda (tal cual a las fotos) y súper tranquila,( de noche se podía ver el cielo estrellado desde dentro de la casa) el lugar es hermoso !! hay mucho para caminar y recorrer. La casa esta alejada del centro pero muy cerca de todos los accesos a los puntos turísticos, lo que nos vino genial : ) . Esperamos volver nos encanto mucho Bariloche. Besos y gracias .

Gracias Muriel por tu atención y hospitalidad en nuestra estadía.
La cabaña es excelente, sumamente acogedora y tiene todo lo que se necesita. En contacto con la naturaleza, sumamente accesible en auto y a sólo 15 min. del centro de Bariloche. Altamente recomendable.

La cabaña pirámide es incluso más linda que en las fotos!  Muriel es una excelente anfitriona que cuidó cada detalle para que nuestra estadía fuera la mejor .
La recomiendo 100%. Nos encantaría haber pasado más tiempo allí y volveremos cada vez que estemos por la zona.

Una cabaña de ensueño en un bosque maravilloso, naturaleza en su maxima expresion y comodidades inmejorables.
Juana excelentisima amfitrión!

La estadía en la pirámide de Muriel fue una de las mejores experiencias de mi vida.
La cabaña, además de encontrarse en un lugar mágico, tiene absolutamente todo lo necesario para estar cómodo y pasarla bien.
Muriel y su familia son gente increíble! sin dudas no será la última vez que los visite.

Muy lindo lugar con mucha calma, y vista al cerro lopez y capilla.
La piramida es calida, sé duerme muy bien. La cama esta en un otro cuarto actualmente. Tiene grandes ventanas al jardin, pero claro hacé calor en la tarde..
El lugar no esta cerquita de la ruta principal. 

Muriel muy simpatica y amable, y los chicos tambien !

Esperamos volver..

Un lugar muy especial para quienes, como mi marido y yo, disfrutan de la tranquilidad, el silencio, la naturaleza y los animales. La Pirámide de Muriel tiene todo lo que nosotros necesitamos para una muy cómoda estadia. Es un bello lugar, construido en un entorno privilegiado, con una excelente anfitriona, de presencia muy discreta, lo que asegura excelente atención y mucha privacidad. Gracias Muriel.
The host canceled this reservation 105 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Thanks, Muriel, even for us it was a pleasure to meet you and to stay in your piramide! We enjoied every day and your tipps were very helpful. We hope to meet you again
Gabi and Peter

Muriel was a great host and very friendly.  Her place is pretty far out like other people have said and walking up the road for 20 minutes after a long hike during the day was kind of annoying but if you have a car it would be better.  I would not recommend staying here in winter if you are sensitive to the cold but I am sure it would be perfect in other seasons...we were cold, especially at night, although we had the heat on high.  The hiking around her house is gorgeous and I would definitely recommend going on the trails around there!!

This is an excellent cabin in the woods a lovely 20 minute walk to the best swimming lake around (warm, calm, clean clear water). We swam every day. 
The setting is lovely, countryside outside Bariloche and we were happy to have stayed here—well away from the road around the lake, with total quiet and a million stars at night. 
Beds were comfortable. Hammock out front was perfect to read in. 
The cottage kitchen is well equipped including a thermos for tea or mate on hikes. 
We had a couple of excellent fancy dinners at “La Masia” just 4 km down the road. Best food and views of our monthlong stay in Argentina.

Staying in Muriel's pyramid was really nice. More close to nature in hardly possible!!! She made us feel very comfortable and helped us with everything we needed. Absolutely recommendable if you are looking for a quiet place to relax and enjoy the forest.

Un logement atypique dans une région merveilleuse. 
Une belle expérience. Il peut par contre faire très chaud dans la journée à l'intérieur de la pyramide.
Muriel s'est montré très prévenante, et n'a pas hésité à nous aider spontanément.

Staying in Piramid was great and i felt like home. Mauriel was very helpful with everything, explained which are the best activities in the area, gave me a ride to downtown and made me feel really welcomed.
The house is outside the city center nearby the beautiful forest and lakes. Take a chance and walk in the forest, it is amazing.
Really nice!

Thanks Mauriel!
The cabin was great and the location was beautiful. Could use a couple new mattresses, but over all it was a very enjoyable stay.
Muriel allowed us to extend our stay one extra night when our plane flight was changed. Thanks so much!
reviews.response: You'll welcome. I hope to ser you again!!

reviews.comments: Muriel was wonderful, and accommodated our schedule and was available whenever we had questions. As other guests have described, this cabin is tucked away in a quiet, beautiful corner away from the business of downtown, and was exactly what we were looking for. It is plenty of space for two people, and would easily accommodate a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 children). We had a lot more space than we anticipated, which was a great surprise. We were doing research (field work) in the area for a month, so it served as the perfect home base-- but would also have been great for a shorter visit. Thanks so much!!

Excelente! foi maravilhoso estar ai. Chegamos com muito frio e a cabana estava aquecida, esperando por nós. Nunca sentíamos frio dentro da cabana. Que está decorada e muito aconchegante. Foi um espetáculo ficar na cabana de Muriel, que é muito agradável e nos deu total liberdade. Sem falar nos cachorros carinhosos e maravilhosos que todos os dias vinham nos ver. Vale muito apena alugar a cabana de Muriel porque em Bariloche para tudo se precisa de carro, por isso alugamos um e a casa dela fica longe do barulho, num lugar tranquilo e perto de tudo.

Muriel's cabin was great! Would love to live there permanently if we could! Twenty minute walk to the bus stop where you can catch the bus to downtown. Its perfect for a more natural stay away from the tourist scene of Bariloche. Cabin has the essentials, several nights we cooked there and enjoyed the quietness w/a bottle of wine. Highly recommend.

If you are staying Bariloche, don't stay in the center of town, go to the woods! Muriel's Cabin is the coolest! It had everything we needed. Perfect place for those who desire seclusion, nature, and are trying to stay "unplugged."
Thus being said, the area it is in, is far from town and will require some walking(if you do not have a car) and bus rides(if you need to go into town or get groceries) It is about a 30 minute walk to the bus stop. 
However, you can hike anywhere and reach many of the nearby lakes by foot pretty quickly. A very inspiring place to be, and Muriel is a very lovely tranquil person, she will help you with whatever you may need. 

Si te vas a Bariloche, es mejor a quedar en las montañas entre el bosque, no en al centro! La cabaña de Muriel es genial! La cabaña tenia todo que necessitamos. Es  perfecto para tener paz, tranquilidad, la naturaleza y estar "unplugged."
Si te vas sin auto, podes caminar a mucho de los lagos y hacer trekking re-facil. Pero, para ir alguno almacen o súper necesitas a caminar o tomar el colectivo. La parada del colectivo es mas o menos 30 minutes caminando. 
Es un lugar con mucha inspiracion y Muriel es un mujer muy amable, tranquila, y ayudante con cualquiera cosa que necesite.

Muriel's pyramid cabin was absolutely magical! We loved our stay here. The pyramid is cosy, clean and private, and Muriel was a very helpful and kind host. The top of the pyramid is the perfect spot to watch the clouds and stars.
 We would definitely stay here again - it is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the beautiful peaceful nature of Bariloche!

Muriel 's Cabin is amazing, actually perfect.!!!!
She is very nice and polite and of course she helped us with everything.!!!! I will strong recommend her cabin.:)

Loved the Pyramid and the local area. Although within easy reach of Bariloche and local shops it was beautifully secluded with some lovely walks and lakes very near by. The cabin itself was perfect and had small garden to sit in and enjoy the sun. Muriel was an incredibly helpful host which made our stay very easy.

Muriel was an awesome host, giving tons of excellent local recommendations for hikes and activities.

The cabin itself was perfect very cozy and private.  We had a rental car so the drive to and from Bariloche wasn't bad at all, about 20 minutes.  

Had an amazing time!

The pyramid cabin was a very special place to be with a great view of the mountains, in the middle of the nature. Muriel was a very kind host and we really enjoyed our time there. The only "disadvantage" (the price for some silence in the nature) however is the 1.5 km walk day by day from the bus stop to the cabin. But all in one we have had a great time!

Muriel was a great host.  Very accommodating, gave great advice and even helped us out a lot with booking cabs and such since we didn't have a phone with us.  Nice, cozy cabin.  Great view of the stars at night.  Thanks Muriel!

We loved our stay at Muriel's pyramid cabin! It was very cosy but still spacious enough to accommodate all of our stuff. Not to mention the hot water was plentiful! We rented a car and therefore loved the location (5 minute drive off the main road, within a few kilometers of many outdoor activities). Muriel was incredibly helpful and easy to communicate with. Perfect Bariloche getaway!

Muriel is incredibly sweet and helpful, and the place was beautiful. The pyramid is pretty far out of town but close to other local activities (horseback-riding, bike rentals, and restaurants are scattered everywhere), so if you've planned local activities, it's great. It's about a 45 minute ride into Bariloche on the bus, and the buses run every 20 minutes. You can also just start hiking from the pyramid, and lakes are close. She has three sweet, big dogs, so it helps if you like dogs. :)

Beautiful little wooden chalet in the woods 19 km from Bariloche town. Self contained with small kitchen with hob, small oven and microwave we were able to stay in the countryside and cook the whole time. The chalet is 15 mins down a country road from the bus stop and beautifully secluded. It is located a short walking distance to a lake for swimming and closer to many of the popular countryside areas to visit around Bariloche than the town itself. Perfect getaway to the countryside but not suitable if you would like to eat in a different restaurant every night. Muriel is an extremely friendly host and gave us tips on the area and her house was located nearby in case we needed anything but far enough away for total privacy. Highly recommend!

This cosy and quirky cabin was just perfect. Easy to get to as it's just one bus away from the bus station in Bariloche and Muriel was kind enough to pick us up and drop us off at the bus stop. The cabin itself is fully equipped  with full size fridge, oven, kettle, microwave etc The location is scluded and beautiful with a wonderful view of mountain peaks. A small, but well stocked shop is just at the end of the road, 15 min walk away. We couldn't have asked for more.

my wife and i stayed at the piramide and had a great time. we were a bit scared to be so far away from town and also have a walk to get to the main road, but it turned out to be no problem at all. there is a nice little store that is only 15 minutes walking. we also found that we could walk across to the the other side of the circuito chico with a nice trail. if you are a rock climber you couldn´t be in a better spot as it is near a spot that even stays dry when it rains.

The pyramid was a bit father outside the city than I had realized, but was even more beautiful than the pictures. Muriel was an excellent host, who went out of her way to drive us, and help us book activities. It was a great experience!
